subtitles.text: I hide and you count to ten
My childish laughter seen through the curtains
Opens all the cabinets, only love in this house
We look happy
You play guitar and we sing "Let it be"
We build castles - sofa cushion fantasies
And when we say goodbye, you give me mandarins
Until we meet again
But days turned into years
Walls were built between us
I missed you, so many times
And you missed me too
We are always connected to each other
Can never lose each other
Even separated in the darkest hours
What we have will never fade away
Through all the curves, serpentines
On rainy days, mistakes forgiven
You weren't there for so many years, but never gone
I always have mandarins in my luggage
Thoughts trembling, knock on your door
Relaxed steps and then you stand before me
In your arms, the last puzzle piece
So many wounds healing
Gray hair but: a familiar look
We both laugh lost time back
Yellowed pictures in old wooden display cases
And there two mandarins
And years turned into days
From wall stones we built a path
All the missed firsts
Don't hurt so much anymore
We are always connected to each other
Can never lose each other
Even separated in the darkest hours
What we have will never fade away
Through all the curves, serpentines
On rainy days, mistakes forgiven
You weren't there for so many years, but never gone
I always have mandarins in my luggage
